page.title: 14MEDICINES AND ILLNESSES
page.content: { Before the days of anti-biotics Dr {Waud of Helperby made up most of his {medicines himself.Few pills were {dispensed,mostly medicines.These were {put in large rectangular bottles and {then corked.He would then put wrapping {paper round them and seal them with {sealing wax. { The medicines would be left in the {surgery for the patients to collect or {the local bus would deliver them to {the sick person's village. { Until a few years ago there were {some nasty illnesses to be found in {this area.The labourers who cut the {sugar beet suffered from {teno-synovitis which really means {swollen arms.Lifting their arms would {make them creak.They would have them {bandaged and rest them for a {week.Chest infection from hay,and {ringworm from cattle were also nasty.
